ArticleTitle.sentence: Nitric oxide-stimulated guanine nucleotide exchange on p21ras.

event.clue: Nitric oxide-stimulated guanine nucleotide exchange on p21ras.
Nitric oxide-stimulated guanine nucleotide exchange on p21ras.

AbstractText.sentence: The protooncogene p21ras, a monomeric G protein family member, plays a critical role in converting extracellular signals into intracellular biochemical events.

event.clue: The protooncogene p21ras, a monomeric G protein family member, plays a critical role in converting extracellular signals into intracellular biochemical events.
The protooncogene p21ras, a monomeric G protein family member, plays a critical role in converting extracellular signals into intracellular biochemical events.

AbstractText.sentence: Here, we report that nitric oxide (NO) activates p21ras in human T cells as evidenced by an increase in GTP-bound p21ras.

event.clue: Here, we report that nitric oxide (NO) activates p21ras in human T cells as evidenced by an increase in GTP-bound p21ras.
Here, we report that nitric oxide (NO) activates p21ras in human T cells as evidenced by an increase in GTP-bound p21ras.

AbstractText.sentence: In vitro studies using pure recombinant p21ras demonstrate that the activation is direct and reversible.
Circular dichroism analysis reveals that NO induces a profound conformational change in p21ras in association with GDP/GTP exchange.

event.clue: Circular dichroism analysis reveals that NO induces a profound conformational change in p21ras in association with GDP/GTP exchange.
Circular dichroism analysis reveals that NO induces a profound conformational change in p21ras in association with GDP/GTP exchange.
Circular dichroism analysis reveals that NO induces a profound conformational change in p21ras in association with GDP/GTP exchange.

AbstractText.sentence: The mechanism of activation is due to S-nitrosylation of a critical cysteine residue which stimulates guanine nucleotide exchange.

event.clue: The mechanism of activation is due to S-nitrosylation of a critical cysteine residue which stimulates guanine nucleotide exchange.
The mechanism of activation is due to S-nitrosylation of a critical cysteine residue which stimulates guanine nucleotide exchange.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, we demonstrate that p21ras is essential for NO-induced downstream signaling, such as NF-kappa B activation, and that endogenous NO can activate p21ras in the same cell.

event.clue: Furthermore, we demonstrate that p21ras is essential for NO-induced downstream signaling, such as NF-kappa B activation, and that endogenous NO can activate p21ras in the same cell.
Furthermore, we demonstrate that p21ras is essential for NO-induced downstream signaling, such as NF-kappa B activation, and that endogenous NO can activate p21ras in the same cell.

AbstractText.sentence: These studies identify p21ras as a target of the same cell.
These studies identify p21ras as a target of NO in T cells and suggest that NO activates p21ras by an action which mimics that of guanine nucleotide exchange factors.

event.clue: These studies identify p21ras as a target of NO in T cells and suggest that NO activates p21ras by an action which mimics that of guanine nucleotide exchange factors.
